intro: Phyteuma spicatum var. roseum, commonly known as the pink spike phyteuma, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and clusters of bell-shaped, pink to rose-colored flowers. The plant typically blooms in late summer, producing showy inflorescences that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it a suitable addition to rock gardens or borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its vibrant color and architectural form.
